name: Vietnamese Ground Pork and Chrysanthemum Greens soup (Canh Tần Ô/Caỉ Cúc Nấu Thịt Băm)
description: A traditional Vietnamese soup with ground pork and Chrysanthemum greens. Serve with steamed rice and other side dishes for a complete Vietnamese family meal.
keywords: vietnamese chrysanthemum greens soup with ground pork, vietnamese cai cuc soup, vietnamese rau tan o soup, vietnamese tan o soup, tan o soup, cai cuc soup, vietnamese soup with ground pork, vietnamese canh recipe, vietnamese recipe, vietnamese soup recipe, asian soup recipe, easy asian soup recipe, vietnamese home cooking recipe, vietnamese soup, how to make vietnamese soup, how to make canh, how to cook canh, vietnamese home cooking, vietnamese ground pork and chrysanthemum greens soup, Canh Tần Ô, Canh Caỉ Cúc Nấu Thịt Băm, canh tan o, canh cai cuc, chrysanthemum greens soup, rau tan o, cai cuc, vietnamese shungiku soup, vietnamese canh tan o recipe, vietnamese canh cai cuc recipe

video.name: Vietnamese Ground Pork And Chrysanthemum Greens Soup (Canh Tần Ô/Caỉ Cúc Nấu Thịt Băm)
video.description: A traditional Vietnamese soup with ground pork and Chrysanthemum greens. Serve with steamed rice and other side dishes for a complete Vietnamese family meal.

recipeIngredient: 1 lb chrysanthemum greens/Rau Tần Ô/Caỉ Cúc
recipeInstructions: Prep the ingredients: Peel and finely chop garlic and shallot. Discard any woody stems of the chrysanthemum greens. Snap by hand or cut into bite-size pieces. Set all ingredients aside.
Add vegetable oil to the bottom of a heavy-bottom small pot. Heat on medium-low. Add garlic and shallots. Pan-fry until fragrant (about 5 seconds).

Add ground pork and toss in the garlic and shallot mixture for 5 seconds. Add water and bring the pot to a low simmer and cook for 8 minutes. Occasionally skim off the foam with a spoon or fine mesh, if needed.
Season stock to taste with salt, sugar, fish sauce, and chicken bouillon powder.
Add chrysanthemum greens. Cook for 1 minute on a rolling boil (high heat).
Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with a sprinkle of ground black pepper.
